SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Border
Class representing the borders of a country.
CommandInterface
Command Interface functions JavaDoc
CommandValidator
 
Continent
Class representing the Continents on the Warzone map The Continent objects are identified by an Integer ID.
ContinentAlreadyExistsException
The ContinentAlreadyExistsException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to add a continent that already exists in the game.
ContinentDoesNotExistException
The ContinentDoesNotExistException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to access a continent that does not exist in the game.
Country
Class representing Country to be used within Warzone map
CountryDoesNotExistException
The CountryDoesNotExistException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to access a country that does not exist in the game.
DuplicateBorderException
The DuplicateBorderException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to add a duplicate border between two countries.
DuplicateContinentException
The DuplicateContinentException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to add a duplicate continent.
DuplicateCountryException
The DuplicateCountryException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to add a duplicate country.
GameEngine
The GameEngine class manages the main logic of the game, including handling game phases, user input, and game loops.
GameEngine.GAME_PHASES
Enum representing different phases of the game.
InvalidCommandException
The InvalidCommandException class represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid command is encountered.
InvalidMapException
 
MapInterface
The MapInterface class provides functionality for loading, saving, and validating world maps.
MapInterfaceTest
 
Order
The Order class represents a player's order in the game.
Player
The Player class represents a player in the game.
PlayerDoesNotExistException
The PlayerDoesNotExistException class represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to access a player that does not exist in the game.
PlayGame
The PlayGame class manages the gameplay mechanics including assigning countries to players, issuing reinforcements, issuing orders, and executing orders.
TerminalColors
The TerminalColors class provides constants for ANSI escape codes representing text colors and background colors for terminal output.
TerminalRenderer
The TerminalRenderer class provides methods for rendering various components in a terminal interface, such as a welcome message, a menu, and displaying a map.
WorldMap
Class representing the Warzone map Contains d_countries which is a HashMap containing all the countries on the map
